climbs.name: Rollercoaster
climbs.fa: Tim Toula 2006 FFA: Peter Vintoniv, 26 March 2012

content.description: To the left of Holey Moley, the original route on the wall, are two bolted steep lines. they share the same start and then diverge like a "Y". The left line finishes up a steep spur and is  "Rollercoaster". The crux is apparently about 2/3 of the way up on this left neighbor of Old School Hardman. The rock on this wall is excellent and the grading needs consensus to be more definitive. Tim Toula strongly felt that both of these routes were as hard as 5.13d!
content.location: Rappel the route. Unlike as noted in the new guidebook, these routes have separate anchors. They do not converge and share anchors as the guidebook suggests. Rollercoaster may need chain added to replace the slings that are in place at the time of this writing.

climbs.name: Ride the Wave
climbs.fa: Tim Toula, John Kane, and James Garrett, November 2006

content.description:
A nice, free-flowing sport line up the backside of the

Holey Moley Wall

. Begin by laying off a wavering, thick crack feature and follow the steep line of bolts towards the route's crux at a bulge. Finish the line using a few solid flakes and deep edges. A mild run-out up a trough ends the line at a two bolt chain anchor. A fine line with a fair amount of pump! A great warm-up for the other routes at the wall.
content.protection: Seven bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location:
At the end of the

Holey Moley Wall

, on the right side, around the corner from

Rollercoaster

.

climbs.name: Old School Hardman
climbs.fa: Tim Toula 2006 FFA: Peter Vintoniv, 29 March 2012

content.description:
Another Tim Toula Ibex test piece that has resisted all previous attempts and begs for consensus opinion regarding the grade. The star rating is as reported to me!

Pitch #1: Climb rounded face holds to a crack (this is the same for Rollercoaster) and halfway up crack traverse right and up super steep terrain to the two-bolt belay.

A cool new addition to the Holey Moley wall. You can easily reach across the corridor and clip the first bolt. Some initial difficulties moving through thin crimps and a weird bulge lead to a juggy sidepull rail and your 3rd clip.

A bouldery crux ensues. Long, interesting moves on pockets, crimps and slopers take you into the upper section of 'Rollercoaster' - share the final 3 bolts to finish at the same anchor.

The name - I busted my knuckles bolting (standard) and my partner Sam was bleeding through her tips. We left some blood on the route.. everybody bleeds.
content.location: To the right of 'Ride the Wave', just left and around the corner from 'Rollercoaster'
